qas.question: What year was Gilbert awarded for his efforts?

answers.text: a collection of Aboriginal people's stories

qas.question: What award did Gilbert refuse in 1998?

answers.text: the Human Rights Award for Literature

qas.question: What was the award in 1998 for?

context: In <a1_0>1978<a1_0/> Aboriginal writer <a0_0>Kevin Gilbert<a0_0/> received the National Book Council award for his book Living Black: Blacks Talk to Kevin Gilbert, <a2_0>a collection of Aboriginal people's stories<a2_0/>, and in 1998 was awarded (but refused to accept) <a3_0>the Human Rights Award for Literature<a3_0/> for <a4_0>Inside Black Australia<a4_0/>, a poetry anthology and exhibition of Aboriginal photography. In contrast to previous definitions based solely on the degree of Aboriginal ancestry, in 1990 the Government changed the legal definition of Aboriginal to include any:
